intro: Boeica, commonly known as the common heath, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen shrubs with small, leathery leaves and clustered flowers. The plants typically grow in acidic, well-drained soils and are often found in heathlands and moorlands. Boeica species are known for their adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. They play an important role in maintaining the ecological balance of their native habitats.
